floodArea.county: Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole, Dorset Council, Hampshire

items.message:
River levels are falling in the lower Avon area and are now below the Flood Alert threshold. 
Further rain is expected this afternoon through to Sunday afternoon which may result in this Alert needing to be re-issued.
We will continue to monitor the situation closely.

items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise at the Pillings Lock river gauge as a result of localised thunderstorms. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible from 06:00 tomorrow morning, 08/09/2024. 

Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Slash Lane at Sileby and the Mountsorrel to Sileby road. 

Thunderstorms are forecast between 21:00 on 07/09/24 and 18:00 on 08/09/24, with low confidence over exact timing and locations. We expect river levels to remain high until Tuesday morning, 10/09/2024.

We are closely monitoring the situation.  

Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and never drive through flood water, just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.  

To check the status of road closures online, please visit the One Network live map.

This message will be updated by 15:00 tomorrow, 08/09/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Clyst and Culm and their tributaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message: The risk of flooding from the River Clyst and Culm and their tributaries has now reduced however river levels will remain high. Further heavy rain is expected for the afternoon of Saturday 7th of September and into Sunday 8th September. This flood alert may be issued again, please remain vigilant and take care when near low lying areas.

"Small, flashier rivers and streams may respond to heavy rainfall as a result of localised thunderstorms passing through the area.  This message has been issued pre-emptively ahead of localised thunderstorms between 21:00 on 07/09/24 and 18:00 on 08/09/24.  Given the unpredictable nature of thunderstorms, there is low confidence in the locations and impacts of rainfall at this point.  Areas most at risk are low lying agricultural land, roads and footpaths close to small rivers and streams.  Water levels could rise rapidly and potentially generate deep, fast flows.   
Thunderstorms and heavy rainfall are forecast over the next 24 hours, with low confidence over exact timing and locations.  
We are closely monitoring the situation.  
Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated by 12:00 tomorrow, 08/09/24, or as the situation changes."
